content.description:
This is a great route with hard crux in the middle. It seems like a crimp broke off of the crux. After talking with a local who also said it had broken, this seems to be the case. After sending it I felt like it was probably .13-. the crux is harder than any other move on the wall and harder than any move on Full Facial. Maybe a V7 mono crux? You are coming right off of a decent shake, so the pump isn't much of a factor.

I'd say this route is probably .13- now.
content.protection: 9 bolts to an anchor now with Mussy hooks.
content.location:
It is in between

Bone Flex

and

Bone Machine

.

content.description: It is a great route and a good warmup for some of the harder routes on the wall. This has an early crux and remains pumpy till the shuts.
content.location: This is the sixth route from the right.

content.description: This is an excellent route! Starts on pockets then leads to a layback section before the roof crux. Precise footwork and some creativity gain good holds above with a pumpy and technical finish.
content.protection: 9 bolts to an anchor with Mussy hooks.
content.location: It is the right-most route on the Creamy Salmon Wall.

content.description: Climb the slabby line at the far left of the Creamy Salmon Wall. Pull the roof for the crux.
content.location: This is on the far left on the Creamy Salmon Wall.

content.description: This is a super quality route. Pull small pockets to the finish. The crux is near the top. Enjoy!
content.location: This is the third route from the right.

content.description:
Start the same as

Wishbone

, then follow the bolt line to the right. The crux is low with thin, tension-y pockets.
content.protection: Bolts to coldshuts (now with Mussy hooks).
content.location:
It is just right of

Wishbone

.

climbs.name: Black Velvet
climbs.fa: E. Pals, D. Robertson, S. Johnson

content.description:
This is another excellent route that follows the black streak to the left of

Sterling Coach

.
content.protection: 7 bolts to an anchor with Mussy hooks.
